msContents.summary: Duplicate receipt: Kephallen, the lessor, acknowledges that he received from Alexippos an advance payment of rent in kind (wheat) without interest

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers with 25 lines; the docket in the back is across the fibers
Written in a small and angular hand with letters mostly separated

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 18 (original no. 69) in Bell's inventory

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Demetrios, -- eponymous officer, 19 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 313

div.ab:
In the thirty-fourth year of the reign of Ptolemy, son of Ptolemy Soter month Phaophi, eighteenth day. Kephallen, an Elean of the troop of Demetrios, holder of a 21 aroura. allotment, acknowledges that he has received from Alexippos, a Macedonian of the troop of Antiochos, 100 aroura holder, 41/2 artabs of wheat against the rent coming to me of the thirty-fifth year.
[Docket on verso:] To Kephallen, 41/2 (artabs) of wheat which he has received against the rent.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. III 49 P.Col.Zen. I 49 Corrections in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 125
